headline: Herschel Walker Claims 'There's No Food on the Shelf' in U.S., Slams Biden
author: Fatma Khaled
sentences: The GOP candidate, who will challenge Democratic Senator Raphael Warnock in the upcoming midterm race in Georgia, blamed the Biden administration for not being energy independent enough saying that there are "enemies negotiating deals for us," which he called "ridiculous."

Republican U.S. Senate candidate Herschel Walker claimed Sunday that the country is facing a food shortage, along with an increase in gas prices, while also targeting President Joe Biden on the country's lack of energy independence.
